div.pre: 2186 Pachino, extreme SE Sicily, 1921 (779) Burial: early 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: 250+ EL, AV, 100 AR Lot A-Orsi Syracuse: AV (Agathocles, quadr., thunder- bolt) tetradr. (Agathocles, Nike and trophy) Carthage: EL (prob. Jenkins-Lewis, Grp. V) Siculo-Punic: tetradr. Alexander III: tetradr. Lot B-Ravel Syracuse: 10 AV (Agathocles, thunderbolt) 70 AR (Agathocles, reduced wt. Pegasi) Pegasi: several Disposition: Syracuse 4 (Pachino 1922 and 1924) presumably this bd.; New York (Syracusan pegasus); Ravel 21 re- duced wt. pegasi of Syracuse (in- cluding 9 from Ferruccio Brandis Sale, Canessa, May 22, 1922, 300-8). This collection also contained 4 AV of Aga- thocles with thunderbolt rev. (nos. 253-6) and 6 EL shekels of Carthage of Grp. V-VII (nos. 367-72), possibly also from this hd. Orsi's notes Ravel, NC 1925, pp. 22-8, illus. Jenkins-Lewis, Carthage, p. 58 Currò Pisanò, AIIN 1962-4, pp. 225-6, 239 It seems likely that both Lots A and B relate to a single hd.
